conclusion: Only the half of the square that lies inside the field contributes to the magnetic flux.
The area inside the magnetic field is Ainside = ½ a².
Initial flux Φi is calculated as n B Ainside = n B (½ a²).
Final flux Φf is calculated as n (2B) Ainside = n (2B) (½ a²) = n B a².
Change in flux ΔΦ is calculated as Φf − Φi = n B a² − n B (½ a²) = ½ n B a².
By Faraday’s law, the magnitude of the induced emf is |𝓔| = |ΔΦ| / Δt.
The magnitude of the induced emf is calculated as |𝓔| = (½ n B a²) / Δt.
The induced emf in the coil is 𝓔 = n B a² ⁄ (2 Δt).
